attractions.name: Burj Khalifa
attractions.desc: World’s tallest tower with an observation deck.

attractions.name: Dubai Mall & Fountain
attractions.desc: Shopping + nightly fountain shows.

attractions.name: Old Dubai (Al Fahidi & Creek)
attractions.desc: Historic district, abras (boats), spice & gold souks.

attractions.name: Desert Safari
attractions.desc: Dune bashing, camel rides, and Bedouin-style dinner.

attractions_extra.name: Museum of the Future
attractions_extra.desc: Striking architecture + interactive exhibits on tech futures.

attractions_extra.name: Dubai Frame
attractions_extra.desc: Sky bridge with Old vs New Dubai views.

cultural_tips: Dress modestly in religious or traditional areas.
Public displays of affection are discouraged.
Friday is a key prayer day; some places open later.

attractions.name: Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque
attractions.desc: Iconic white marble mosque open to visitors.

attractions.name: Louvre Abu Dhabi
attractions.desc: World-class art museum on Saadiyat Island.

attractions.name: Corniche Beach
attractions.desc: Family-friendly promenade and beaches.

attractions.name: Qasr Al Watan
attractions.desc: Presidential palace with cultural exhibits.

attractions_extra.name: Saadiyat Beach
attractions_extra.desc: Pristine beach near museums on the island.

cultural_tips: Mosques have dress codes; borrow abayas/scarves if needed.
Taxis and public transport are reliable; use official apps.

attractions.name: Sharjah Museum of Islamic Civilization
attractions.desc: Extensive Islamic art and artifacts.

attractions.name: Al Noor Island
attractions.desc: Garden with sculptures and Butterfly House.

cultural_tips: Sharjah is the most conservative emirate; modest dress is important.
food: Local bakeries for fresh bread and tea

attractions.name: Jebel Jais
attractions.desc: UAE’s highest peak with viewing decks and zipline.

attractions.name: Dhayah Fort
attractions.desc: Hilltop fort with panoramic views.

cultural_tips: Temperatures cooler in the mountains; bring layers.
food: Local fish grills near the corniche

attractions.name: Snoopy Island (Dibba)
attractions.desc: Snorkeling and beach day trips on the east coast.

attractions.name: Fujairah Fort
attractions.desc: Historic fort and heritage village.

cultural_tips: Great weekend escape from Dubai—plan 1.5–2.5 hours drive.

attractions.name: Ajman Beach & Corniche
attractions.desc: Relaxed beachfront with cafés and sunset views.

attractions.name: Ajman Museum (Fort)
attractions.desc: Restored 18th-century fort with local history exhibits.

cultural_tips: Dress modestly when visiting the museum and mosques.
Family-friendly vibe; weekends get busy along the corniche.
food: Local shawarma stands on the Corniche

attractions.name: UAQ Mangroves & Kayaking
attractions.desc: Calm waters—great for bird watching and sunset paddles.

attractions.name: Dreamland Aqua Park
attractions.desc: Classic family waterpark near the coast.

cultural_tips: Plan outdoor activities early morning or late afternoon.
Carry cash for smaller, local vendors.

attractions.name: Jebel Hafeet
attractions.desc: Scenic mountain drive with viewpoints.

attractions.name: Al Ain Oasis
attractions.desc: UNESCO site with shaded date-palm groves and falaj irrigation.

attractions.name: Al Jahili Fort
attractions.desc: Beautiful fort with cultural exhibits and photo shows.

cultural_tips: Al Ain is more traditional—modest dress appreciated.
Bring water; many sites are outdoors.

attractions.name: Hatta Dam & Kayaking
attractions.desc: Turquoise waters surrounded by the Hajar mountains.

attractions.name: Hatta Wadi Hub
attractions.desc: Hiking, mountain biking, archery, and seasonal activities.

attractions.name: Hatta Heritage Village
attractions.desc: Restored village showcasing mountain-life traditions.

cultural_tips: Closed shoes for hiking; temperatures cooler than the coast.
Check activity seasonality (some outdoor hubs are seasonal).

country_facts: Weekend is typically Saturday–Sunday (Friday remains important for congregational prayers).
Taxis are metered; Nol/Hafilat cards for some public transit.
cultural_tips_general: During Ramadan, eating/drinking in public during daylight is restricted.
Tipping is appreciated but not mandatory (5–10%).
